posts.post_content:
Offering here a beautiful team cabinet photo of the Harvard baseball club. Not dated but judging from uniforms appears to be 1870s or 1880s and measures aprroximately 6.5 in. x 4.5 in. Obvious condition issues but rare indeed. The tape on the back is actually on the plastic case, not the photo itself. Feel free to ask any questions at [url]javanbrigham@verizon.net[/url].

Price is $650 with paypal gift although I'm willing to listen to offers.
What leads you to believe that this is the Harvard team?
I didn't want to interfere with the sale but it doesn't look like Harvard to me either. They never wore those uniforms. Nice image, nonetheless.

Perhaps I was misinformed. I found this item sold at Hunts in 2009 and described as a Harvard team cabinet. I bought it from a fellow collector last year. The link is below. It was lot #308.
Any help would be appreciated.

[url]http://www.huntauctions.com/online/view_lots_items_list_closed.cfm?auction=23&start_number=301&last_number=400[/url]

Here's my picture of the 1882 Harvard baseball team.  I own a few others from the era (give or take a couple of years), and the uniforms all look similar to what is seen here, with just an "H" on the jerseys.

One other thought - Marlboro Mass. is about 40-45 minutes west of Harvard, while Boston is about 10 minutes away.  So if (esp. in the 1870s-1880s) one were looking for a photographer, proximity would be of the utmost importance. 

With a large number of photography studios in Boston (and in Cambridge) at the time, I would see it strange to use a photographer located so far away from Harvard.

[quote name="scooter729" post=896815]One other thought - Marlboro Mass. is about 40-45 minutes west of Harvard, while Boston is about 10 minutes away.  So if (esp. in the 1870s-1880s) one were looking for a photographer, proximity would be of the utmost importance. 

With a large number of photography studios in Boston (and in Cambridge) at the time, I would see it strange to use a photographer located so far away from Harvard.[/QUOTE]

I was thinking it might be a reference to Harvard, Mass (the town), which is a bit closer to Marlborough.

Almost 99% of all Harvard cabinets would have been taken by Pach Bros. 

Scott
